item.title: Are AI Detectors Good Enough? A Survey on Quality of Datasets With Machine-Generated Texts
item.description: AI text detectors struggle in real-world scenarios despite high benchmark scores; this study reveals dataset quality issues and proposes evaluation methods for better AI detection.

item.title: BiGR: Harnessing Binary Latent Codes for Image Generation and Improved Visual Representation Capabilities
item.description: BiGR: Unifying image generation and discrimination using compact binary codes for superior quality and representation.

item.title: EvoPress: Towards Optimal Dynamic Model Compression via Evolutionary Search
item.description: EvoPress: A novel evolutionary algorithm optimizes dynamic LLM compression, surpassing existing methods in accuracy and efficiency.

item.title: How Do Training Methods Influence the Utilization of Vision Models?
item.description: Training methods dramatically impact vision model utilization: some boost early layers, others prioritize deeper ones, revealing crucial insights into neural network functionality.

item.title: Montessori-Instruct: Generate Influential Training Data Tailored for Student Learning
item.description: MONTESSORI-INSTRUCT: A novel data synthesis framework tailors synthetic data generation to student learning preferences, significantly improving student model performance.

item.title: NaturalBench: Evaluating Vision-Language Models on Natural Adversarial Samples
item.description: NaturalBench: A new benchmark exposes VLMs’ weaknesses on natural adversarial samples, revealing significant biases and highlighting the need for improved visio-linguistic skills.

item.title: Teaching Models to Balance Resisting and Accepting Persuasion
item.description: LLMs can now better resist manipulation while also learning from helpful advice, thanks to a new training method that balances resisting misinformation with accepting helpful persuasion!
